1.text: Decide what kind of oil cleaning method you want to use.

2.text: Purchase or get out any materials you need for the job.

3.text: Wear protective clothing and gear if you are using degreasers.

4.text: Locate the number of poison control and keep pets or small children away from chemicals.
4.vid: /3/37/Clean Oil Off a Driveway Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4

5.text: Clean the area with oil stains with water from a hose or bucket.
5.vid: /7/72/Clean Oil Off a Driveway Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4

6.text: Pour detergent on the affected area.
6.vid: /8/8f/Clean Oil Off a Driveway Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4

7.text: Use hot water to scrub the detergent with a brush.
7.vid: /4/4f/Clean Oil Off a Driveway Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4

8.text: Use a poultice mixture on hard to remove, small stains.

9.text: Pour a couple of cans of Coke or Pepsi on the affected area.
9.vid: /1/10/Clean Oil Off a Driveway Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4

10.text: Apply the recommended amount of degreaser to the area you want to clean.
10.vid: /2/2b/Clean Oil Off a Driveway Step 10 Version 2.360p.mp4

11.text: Scrub the area hard with your steel or stiff bristle brush.
11.vid: /6/66/Clean Oil Off a Driveway Step 11 Version 2.360p.mp4

12.text: Use microbial cleansers, not chemicals, to remove oil from concrete.
12.vid: /e/ef/Clean Oil Off a Driveway Step 12 Version 2.360p.mp4
